title: 'No proof of life': Imran Khan’s son sparks new round of doubts amid health rumours
content: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan's son alleges his father is held in a death cell with no transparency. Kasim Khan states there have been no calls or meetings, and no proof of life. Khan's sisters have been denied visits despite court orders. The family urges international intervention and proof of life.

title: 'Bandh hai’: Once a lifeline for distressed women, Delhi Mahila Aayog lies defunct
content: Since Jan 2024, the Delhi Commission for Women has had no chairperson, and no members since July 2024. In May 2024, Women and Child Development dept ordered removal of 223 contractual staffers over “improper” hiring . The last chairperson, Swati Maliwal, resigned after being elected to the Rajya Sabha in Jan 2024.

title: 'Both had to do something in India': Congress leader claims CIA–Mossad behind 2014 rout
content: A war of words erupted between Congress and BJP after former MP Kumar Ketkar alleged US and Israeli intelligence agencies meddled in the 2014 elections. BJP MP Sambit Patra countered, attributing BJP's victories to public support and accusing Congress of following Pakistan's ISI agenda.

title: IND vs SA: Is India bothered about Test debacle?
content: India's Test cricket legacy is rapidly declining, particularly at home, as the focus shifts to white-ball glory from junior levels. This prioritization of T20 and ODI formats has led to a neglect of red-ball skills, with junior selectors and players alike prioritizing white-ball success, impacting the development of Test specialists.

title: Hong Kong high-rise blaze: Death toll climbs to 94 - latest developments
content: A devastating fire ripped through Hong Kong's Wang Fuk Court apartment complex, claiming 94 lives and leaving scores unaccounted for. Firefighters battled the blaze for two days amidst severe obstacles, with the fire believed to have started in scaffolding. Investigations are underway as residents report a lack of fire alarms.

title: Chinese tech giants and Nvidia chips; may have found a workaround; US blockade tested
content: Chinese tech giants like Alibaba and ByteDance are reportedly training their advanced AI models in overseas data centers, primarily in Southeast Asia, to circumvent US restrictions on powerful Nvidia chips. This strategy allows them to access necessary computing power despite export bans, with some companies also using these facilities for global cloud services.

title: 'Reunion of the Year': Dhoni drives Kohli back after dinner in Ranchi - video
content: A heartwarming video of MS Dhoni driving Virat Kohli back to his hotel after a private dinner at Dhoni's Ranchi residence has gone viral. The rare sight, with no security, evoked nostalgia for their decade-long partnership. Kohli is in Ranchi for the ODI series against South Africa, marking his return to the city.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 85,750
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 was above 26,200, BSE Sensex was near 85,750.

title: Apple vs $38 billion fine: Apple goes to High Court to avoid penalty; calls it unconstitutional and unjust
content: Apple is challenging India's new antitrust penalty framework in Delhi High Court, fearing a potential $38 billion fine based on global turnover. The iPhone maker argues the amended law, allowing penalties on worldwide revenue, is unconstitutional and disproportionate. This challenge follows an investigation into Apple's App Store practices and mandatory in-app purchase system.

title: ‘It’s like Covid’: Kiran Bedi flags Delhi pollution crisis; claims AQI hits 587 in Indirapuram
content: Former IPS officer Kiran Bedi has voiced grave concerns over Delhi's hazardous air quality, with the AQI reaching alarming levels. She highlighted the severe health impacts and the need for stronger political leadership, advocating for Prime Minister's intervention to coordinate multi-state efforts.

title: Daughter's 1st birthday: Diogo Jota's widow posts heartbreaking tribute
content: Diogo Jota's widow, Rute Cardoso, shared an emotional first-birthday tribute to their baby daughter, posting poignant photos of the late Liverpool star. The images, including five with Jota, have evoked widespread love and grief, underscoring the profound impact of his tragic death. Jota died in a car crash just weeks after marrying Rute, leaving behind their three children.

title: 'Are you a stupid person?': Trump slams reporter questioning him over White House shooting
content: President Trump criticized the Biden administration's immigration policies, blaming them for the recent shooting near the White House. He asserted that the administration allowed unvetted individuals to enter the US, including the suspect in the shooting, Rahmanullah Lakanwal. Trump also reiterated his criticism of the Afghanistan withdrawal, calling it a mess and a mistake.

title: AI at work: Nvidia CEO to employees in leaked recording; says managers are ‘insane’ to ban it
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has strongly rebuked managers urging employees to reduce AI use, emphasizing its integration into all operations. He assured staff that AI adoption won't lead to job losses, highlighting Nvidia's continued expansion and hiring. The company's impressive revenue growth and market dominance underscore its commitment to accelerating AI.

title: Map mishap: Delhi man follows GPS to friend’s address, lands into swamp; car catches fire
content: A man's routine drive took a terrifying turn when his navigation app directed him into a swamp, leading his car to catch fire. He was trapped inside but was rescued by his brother and a friend just before the vehicle was engulfed in flames.

title: Bihar woman gets death penalty for killing daughter after being caught with another man
content: In a harrowing case from Araria, a mother's horrifying act of violence has led to her death sentence for the murder of her young daughter. The court branded this tragedy as one of the 'rarest of the rare' after she committed the heinous crime of poisoning and nearly decapitating the innocent girl to keep her silence about an extramarital affair.

title: 'Not gonna have weird loyalty …': Nikki Haley’s son distances from Indian roots
content: Nikki Haley's son, Nalin, expressed a strong stance against immigration, stating he feels no "weird loyalty" to countries he hasn't visited. He argued that legal immigration is irresponsible given the current "fragile economy" and job displacement by AI, advocating for prioritizing American workers.

title: IND vs SA: 'The biggest fault' - Harbhajan Singh lashes out at Team India
content: South Africa dominated the Test through strong batting contributions led by Senuran Muthusamy’s maiden century and Marco Jansen’s explosive 93. Jansen, who also took 6/48 in the first innings, dismantled India’s batting order before Simon Harmer completed the rout with a match-winning 6/37 in the second innings.  South Africa sealed a commanding 408-run win, with Harmer finishing as Player of the Series for his 17 wickets across two Tests, while Jansen claimed the Player of the Match award for his all-round brilliance.

title: Shooting near White House: One of two National Guards shot dies; other ‘fighting for his life’
content: Tragedy struck near the White House as a National Guard soldier, Sarah Beckstrom, succumbed to injuries from a shooting. President Trump announced her death, stating the second soldier is critically wounded. The alleged attacker, an Afghan national with prior CIA ties, is also injured and will face severe repercussions. The incident prompted lockdowns of nearby federal buildings.

title: ‘Can’t take her dad’s hard-earned money’: UP groom returns Rs 31 lakh dowry, stuns guests
content: A groom in Agra, Awadhesh Rana, refused a dowry of Rs 31 lakh, accepting only Rs 1 as shagun.  His act of returning the money, earned by the bride's late father, was met with appreciation, sending a strong message against the dowry system and promoting equality in marriage.

title: Multi-layered problem: Why no Indians made Candidates 2026 via Goa WC
content: Uzbekistan's Javokhir Sindarov, a 19-year-old, became the youngest World Cup winner, securing a spot in the 2026 Candidates. India, hosting the event after 23 years, saw its 24 players fail to reach the top three qualifying spots. The article explores the knockout format's challenges, home advantage pressures, and the impact of chess engines on creativity.

title: 'You have criminal record': Sikh man stopped from entering Canada from US
content: An Indian-origin Sikh man, claiming US citizenship, was denied entry into Canada by a border officer due to a prior criminal record. The man accused the officer of religious discrimination, but the officer explained the decision was based on Canadian databases and laws, not his religion or origin. The video of the interaction that the man recorded went viral.

title: CM Kar'nataka' : Sidda, DKS await high-command call; caste groups turn up the heat
content: Karnataka's Congress leadership is awaiting a Delhi call to resolve the CM tussle between Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar.  A meeting is tentatively set for Saturday, contingent on Rahul Gandhi's availability.  Meanwhile, caste-based organizations are openly backing their preferred leaders, issuing warnings about potential repercussions for the party if their demands aren't met.

title: SC to govt: Need to pre-screen social media content; warns of viral ‘damage’ risk
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Information and Broadcasting Ministry to draft a mechanism for pre-screening user-generated content on social media. The court emphasized the need for a preventive measure to curb the rapid spread of potentially damaging or anti-national content before it goes viral, acknowledging the limitations of post-takedown actions.

title: Delhi blast probe: Muzammil stored explosives in shed; NIA traces two more hideouts
content: Investigators uncovered two more hideouts linked to Al-Falah University professor Muzammil Ahmad Ganaie, who was making IEDs. He had stored 2,600kg of ammonium nitrate at a mosque shed before moving it to a cleric's house, from where it was seized just before the Delhi blast.

title: Fresh I-T push: 25k flagged for foreign assets, income; advised to review returns by Dec 31
content: The Income Tax Department has launched a fresh campaign targeting individuals with undeclared overseas assets and income.  Around 25,000 high-risk cases will be initially contacted via SMS and email. This initiative aims to encourage taxpayers to review and revise their returns by December 31 to avoid significant penalties under the Black Money Act.

title: Hidden dangers of sugar-free snacks on gut health, insulin, and weight gain
content: A Delhi doctor warns that zero-sugar products can be misleading, potentially causing overeating and harming gut health. Artificial sweeteners and refined ingredients in diet foods may trigger insulin spikes and increase cravings, despite lacking calories. Experts advise prioritizing whole, minimally processed foods for better metabolic wellness and sustainable weight management.

title: Congress netas blame excessive focus on 'vote chori' for Bihar debacle
content: Senior Congress functionaries cited a disproportionate focus on national issues over local concerns like cost of living and corruption as reasons for the party's decimation in Bihar. They urged central leadership to fix accountability for the defeat and revive the party's prospects in the state.  Discussions also touched upon candidate selection, alliance strategies, and the impact of caste census advocacy.

title: SC to govt: Consider law to curb ridiculing of disabled; centre flags impact on artists
content: The Supreme Court suggested a law similar to the SC/ST Act to protect differently-abled individuals from ridicule. While the government acknowledged the concern, it raised potential issues for creative artists. The court also directed comedians to host shows featuring SMA achievers, contributing earnings to patient treatment.

title: ‘India’s space leap’: PM inaugurates Skyroot Infinity campus; Vikram-I commercial rocket unveiled
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Skyroot Aerospace's new Infinity campus in Hyderabad. He also unveiled Vikram-I, India's first commercial orbital rocket. This marks a significant step for India's private space sector. Skyroot aims to launch Vikram-I within two months. The company is creating high-tech jobs and plans further investment. India is becoming a global leader in satellite launches.

title: Fatty Liver Warning Signs: Don't Ignore These 8 Symptoms
content: Fatty liver can creep up on you without any overt symptoms, but your body may be sending out warning signs. According to Dr. Saurabh Sethi, unexpected weight gain around the belly, increased blood sugar levels, darker urine, ongoing fatigue, and discomfort in the upper abdomen are all red flags.

title: ‘Hitler-era repression’: Imran Khan’s sister slams jail treatment; family barred from meetings
content: Imran Khan's sister, Noreen Niazi, has voiced grave concerns over the former prime minister's treatment in prison, stating the family is kept in the dark and he is subjected to isolation. She alleges unprecedented repression and violence against supporters outside Adiala Jail, warning of public anger reaching a breaking point.

title: DKS vs Sidda: Shivakumar says ‘word power’ post misread; clarifies his remarks
content: Karnataka deputy chief minister DK Shivakumar clarified his "word power" social media post was intended for the legal fraternity on Constitution Day, not a political jab at Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.

title: 'They suffered a lot': Vanessa Bryant on retrieving Kobe and Gianna’s clothing
content: Vanessa Bryant bravely recounted the harrowing aftermath of Kobe and Gianna's tragic deaths, revealing her distress over first responders photographing the crash site. She expressed deep pain, fearing leaked images of her loved ones, and sued the Sheriff's Department for emotional distress. This led to a substantial settlement, acknowledging the profound impact of the privacy breach.

title: SC orders nationwide audit of all private & deemed universities
content: The Supreme Court has ordered a nationwide audit of all private and deemed universities in response to a student's grievance. This sweeping directive demands sworn affidavits on their establishment, governance, regulatory approvals, and non-profit status, aiming to expose structural opacity and assess regulatory oversight.

title: G20 showdown: Trump torches SA over 'white genocide'; Ramaphosa fires back
content: President Trump has accused South Africa of genocide against white people, threatening to ban the nation from the G-20 summit and halt aid. South Africa's President Ramaphosa refuted these claims, calling them baseless and from a fringe group. The G-20's consensus-based nature makes unilateral expulsion unlikely, despite escalating global political tensions.

title: ‘10–15 assailants’: NCP(SP) functionary critically injured in attack; political rivalry suspected
content: Beed-based NCP (SP) politician Ram Khade was critically injured in a brutal attack by 10-15 assailants near Mandali village. Khade's associates allege the assault was politically motivated, stemming from his recent corruption complaints. Police are investigating, reviewing CCTV footage, and seeking to identify the armed attackers.

title: Nifty50, Sensex hit lifetime highs: What's driving rally & is it sustainable? Explained
content: Stock market at record high! Nifty50 has crossed 26,300 and Sensex has gone past 86,000 for the first time. There is renewed optimism about the Indian stock markets - but is the current rally sustainable? Here's what experts have to say:

title: Who is Jack White? Eminem teams up with rock legend for Thanksgiving halftime show
content: Detroit's own rock legend Jack White is set to electrify the Thanksgiving halftime show during the Packers vs. Lions game. Known for his iconic guitar riffs and hits like "Seven Nation Army," White promises a high-energy performance celebrating hometown pride.  Executive-produced with input from Eminem, the show blends nostalgia and local flavor, also supporting Feeding America.

title: Who was Fuzzy Zoeller? Two-time major champion golfer dies at 74
content: Golf legend Fuzzy Zoeller, the last player to win the Masters on his debut in 1979 and a 1984 U.S. Open champion, has passed away at 74. Known for his personality and memorable moments, Zoeller's career also included a notable controversy in 1997. He leaves behind a legacy of significant wins and sportsmanship.

title: New quake map: Himalayan arc in highest danger zone
content: India has released a new earthquake map. The entire Himalayan region is now in the highest risk zone. Over 60% of India faces moderate to high earthquake hazards. New building codes will ensure greater safety. Infrastructure projects must meet stricter standards. This update reflects a scientific approach to seismic assessment.

title: No dent in pollution as court orders not followed, SC told
content: The Supreme Court acknowledged its limitations in tackling Delhi-NCR's air pollution, stating it lacks a 'magic wand.' Decades of judicial intervention have yielded minimal results, with authorities failing to implement past orders. The court emphasized the need for long-term, year-round solutions involving domain experts and coordinated government efforts, rather than just winter-specific actions.

title: How WH shooter Rahmanullah Lakanwal made it to US: Inside Operation Allies Welcome
content: Operation Allies Welcome, a federal initiative meant to aid Afghans escaping the Taliban, finds itself in a troubling spotlight following a shooting incident that injured two National Guard members. Investigations reveal that the program has been marred by substantial data inaccuracies and lack of thorough oversight, raising concerns over the vetting process.

title: Mahomes: Chiefs 'got to win every game now'
content: After the Chiefs' loss to the Cowboys, QB Patrick Mahomes summed up the team's bleak playoff chances. "You've got to win every game now -- and hope that's enough," he said.

title: Thanksgiving Love: Pack QB tosses 4 TDs in win
content: The Packers feasted once again on Thanksgiving, with QB Jordan Love tossing four touchdown passes in a 31-24 win over the Lions.

title: Campbell: Lions in 'little bit of a hole' after loss
content: Even coach Dan Campbell could admit after the Lions' 31-24 Thanksgiving Day loss to the Packers, that "we've dug ourselves a little bit of a hole" at 7-5 overall.

title: 2-time major champion Fuzzy Zoeller dies at 74
content: Fuzzy Zoeller, a two-time major champion and one of golf's most gregarious characters whose career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke about Tiger Woods, has died, according to a longtime colleague. He was 74.

title: Gaethje-Pimblett to headline UFC 324 in January
content: An interim lightweight title fight between Justin Gaethje and Paddy Pimblett will headline UFC 324 on Jan. 24 in Las Vegas.

title: Drinkwitz agrees to new 6-year deal with Missouri
content: Missouri has agreed to a new six-year contract with coach Eliah Drinkwitz with an average annual compensation of $10.75 million, the school announced Thursday.

title: Questions, takeaways from Thanksgiving matchups: Our reporters break down every game
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer big questions from each Week 13 game, starting with Thanksgiving Day matchups.

title: 37 games with postseason implications to fill your Rivalry Week menu
content: As if the intensity of rival games weren't enough, there are high stakes everywhere you look this weekend.

title: Week 14 preview: Rivalry Week stakes, plus conference championship scenarios
content: Ahead of Rivalry Week, our college football experts get into the stakes in the biggest matchups of Week 14.

title: Where is the best landing spot for Lane Kiffin?
content: The coach will announce his decision later in the week. Here's what he might be weighing in the meantime.

title: WWE Survivor Series: Key stats and info to know before WarGames
content: As we approach Saturday's WWE premium live event, let's catch up on some notes and stats for each match.

title: Preview: Can the teams coexist?
content: Breaking down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

title: Women's Feast Week guide: Texas wins inaugural Players Era on Harmon's game winner
content: With Players Era wins over UCLA and South Carolina, Texas established itself as the No. 2 team in the country.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 3.0: Reyna, Scally back in the fold
content: We're closing in on the new year, and with months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make next year's squad?

title: Chaos for Barcelona and Liverpool, Arsenal No. 1: Reranking the Champions League
content: With just three games left, Arsenal look like the best team in the competition, while Barcelona, Liverpool and Man City are spiraling. Let's review how the UEFA Champions League looks after Matchday 5.

title: Talking points: Pep's tinkering costs City, Arsenal look unstoppable
content: Statement wins, coaches under pressure and bizarre team selections. ESPN writers break down Matchday 5.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Everything to know before Friday's final night of group play
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: How Tyrese Maxey went from the hardwood to the 2025 National Dog Show
content: The Philadelphia 76ers star ran two dogs through the Purina Pro Plan Incredible Dog Challenge Agility Show while the show taped in Philadelphia.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: The Thanksgiving Panic Index: Which NHL teams are the most concerned?
content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

title: MLB offseason survey: 16 execs predict free agency, blockbuster trades and more
content: We surveyed the sport on the biggest free agents and top trade candidates as baseball's hot stove heats up.

title: NFL Week 13 buzz: What we're hearing on the struggling Bucs, Pickens' next deal, fantasy football
content: Are the Buccaneers worried about their losing streak? Will the Cowboys extend George Pickens? Here's the latest intel, plus fantasy football advice.

title: Black Friday betting: Big games coming for Hurts, Barkley vs. streaking Bears?
content: Odds, game bets, prop plays and analysis to help you bet the Chicago Bears-Philadelphia Eagles Black Friday matchup.

title: Is it time for McLaren to prioritize Norris over Piastri?
content: McLaren has refused to favor one driver over the other all season, but as Max Verstappen closes in, should the Papaya outfit issue team orders?

title: Fantasy fast break: Eric Moody on Mikal Bridges' durability, Kel'el Ware's rise and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Mikal Bridges' durability and production in New York, Kel'el Ware's second-year rise and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Haaland to replace Vini Jr at Madrid?
content: Real Madrid are looking at a possible move for Manchester City's Erling Haaland. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: The illusion of flow: U-turns slowing Hyderabad down
content: Once promoted as a smart fix to free up traffic, Hyderabad’s expanding U-turn network is now choking major corridors, triggering violations and contributing to more crashes. As officials scramble for solutions, Lavpreet Kaur and Naveen Kumar trace the mounting commuter angst and widening cracks in the city’s traffic strategy

title: Rupee falls 7 paise to 89.43 against U.S. dollar in early trade
content: At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 89.41; it slipped further to trade at 89.43 against the greenback in initial deals, registering a loss of 7 paise from its previous closing level.

title: In 10 years, this government hospital in Chennai has performed 31,157 interventional cardiac procedures
content: The department has performed among the highest volumes of ASD device closures in the government sector in Tamil Nadu

title: Kerala local body polls: Rivals will seek to loosen LDF’s firm grip on Kollam Corporation
content: Since the formation of the Corporation in 2000, the Left front has been in power. This time, the CPI(M) is not fielding a single sitting member of the current council, hoping that a totally new line-up will get voters’ approval. While the UDF is looking for a recovery from a major setback in the 2020 elections, the NDA, having tripled its seats in 2020, is highly optimistic about its prospects

title: Kerala local body polls: Writing on the wall is clear, charm of poll graffiti doesn’t fade
content: The old world charm of the wall art is something that political parties and candidates do not want to miss. Graffiti has evolved in terms of colour, design and font

title: Kerala local body polls: Development beckons, but coastal Thiruvananthapuram continues to battle age-old issues
content: Lack of potable water and proper waste disposal mechanism have been issues faced by areas near Vizhinjam for decades. Dwindling catch, eroding beaches and fewer employment opportunities will be key issues in the coastal areas in the local body elections

title: Forcing happily-married couple to face trial under POCSO Act would be irony of fate: Allahabad HC
content: The woman's father got the FIR lodged, alleging that his daughter was abducted in April 2024; the woman had denied the allegations in her statement before police and stated that she had left her parents' home willingly.

title: The hidden costs of 10-minute deliveries
content: Multiple platforms offering 10-minute door delivery of anything under the sun and the middle class getting addicted to it has consequences often not talked about. Chetan B.C. explores how gig economy is adding to traffic and law and order issues.

title: Madras High Court modifies stalker’s death sentence to life imprisonment
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and M. Jothiraman order that he would not be entitled for any remission until he completes 20 years of incarceration

title: Election notice to first phase of Telangana GP Elections-2025 issued
content: The last date to file the nominations for this phase is (5 p.m.) November 29, 2025. The list of contesting candidates would be published on December 3, 2025

title: Why are Srinagar’s traditional livelihoods struggling to survive? | Explained
content: How are wetlands, lakes, and mountains shaping Srinagar’s economy? What role did Article 370’s dilution play in local livelihoods? Why are tourism, horticulture, and artisan trades struggling? What strategies can build a resilient, locally rooted economy?

title: Vice President approves Panjab University senate poll schedule, students say will end stir on Nov 28
content: Panjab University students, who have been protesting and pressing for the election schedule, hailed it as a "victory" of their "struggle".

title: Brainybotz robotics club boosts STEM learning for kids in Visakhapatnam
content: Brainybotz is shaping a culture of hands-on STEM learning for children in Visakhapatnam. It will host the city’s first STEM expo on December 6 at GITAM

title: Woman constable injured in IED explosion in Sukma
content: The incident occurred during an area domination operation, when Constable Muchaki Durga of the District Force accidentally triggered a pressure IED, injuring her left foot

title: Pushing the panic button in West Bengal
content: With the start of SIR in West Bengal, all the major political parties in the State have taken a stand on the revision of electoral rolls. Except the BJP, all parties, including the ruling Trinamool Congress, are opposing the exercise, though they are participating in the process. Among the electorate, confusion and apprehension prevail, The Hindu reports

title: Man held for cutting elderly woman’s ear to steal gold earrings
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the victim, M. Salammal, was living alone in her house, with her children residing a few streets away in the same village.

title: Army chief charts three-phase plan to build future-ready force by 2047
content: Operation Sindoor demonstrates how structural readiness and modernisation can translate into decisive battlefield outcomes, says General Dwivedi

title: Union Law Ministry defends simultaneous polls proposal; says curtailing tenure not against basic structure of Constitution
content: Synchronisation of elections through amendment is permissible, Ministry tells the Parliamentary panel that is examining Bills

title: Telangana High Court directs Sigachi blast case investigating officer to appear before it
content: A Bench of Chief Justice Aparesh Kumar Singh and Justice G.M. Mohiuddin, hearing a PIL plea on Sigachi factory explosion that killed 46 persons, expressed concern over the delay in the probe to fix up responsibility for the explosion inside the factory

title: Two Trinamool workers killed in Bengal’s Malda; police deployed as tensions rise
content: Three people killed in Kaliachak within 48 hours as multiple rounds of shots fired; a local food vendor killed along with two TMC workers

title: Supreme Court asks government to consider a law against ridicule of PwDs
content: “Why don’t you bring some stringent legislation against insulting specially-abled persons, on the lines of the SC/ST Atrocities Act,” Chief Justice Surya Kant asked Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, for the Centre

title: Communal tag on 1983 Assam violence unwarranted: Resurrected panel’s report
content: The Tewary Commission of Enquiry said the fear of the Assamese of being outnumbered by outsiders was envisaged by British administrators much before the organisations spearheading the Assam Agitation were formed

title: Legal notice to Mumbai Police for failure to file FIR against BJP city president for hate speech
content: Days ago, Mumbai BJP Chief, Mr. Satam, stirred controversy after he said that Mumbai will not tolerate the “imposition of a Khan”

title: Orissa HC quashes govt order allowing MPs, MLAs to recommend teachers’ transfer
content: Teachers have to maintain safe distance from political parties and elected representatives, HC observes

title: Rajasthan taking steps to bring excess Yamuna waters during monsoon
content: The decision to divert excess Yamuna waters to Rajasthan follows an agreement signed with the Haryana government in February 2024 for getting the State’s full share of 1.119 billion cusec metre water as per the 1994 Yamuna Water Agreement

title: Telangana food safety officials flag compliance issues by e-commerce players
content: According to data, officials inspected 75 warehouses across 33 districts, seized 1,903 units of expired or misbranded food products and items with misleading labels

title: Sukanta Majumdar faces protests at Diamond Harbour, blames it on Trinamool Congress
content: The Trinamool Congress claimed that supporters of BJP leader Dilip Ghosh were protesting against Sukanta Majumdar

title: Bihar Congress leaders point out flaws after poll loss, but party high command sticks to vote chori
content: The leaders find fault with ticket distribution, “outsiders” being given tickets, lack of coordination with the RJD and leadership of the State’s AICC in-charge

title: After death of two basketball players, Haryana CM orders review of sports complexes
content: Haryana CM Nayab Saini expressed condolences over the deaths and announced ₹5 lakh as financial assistance to the families of each of the deceased

title: Pollution Worsens In Delhi, Air Quality 'Severe' In Most Parts
content: Delhi woke up to worsening air on Friday as the city's overall Air Quality Index (AQI) reached 384 at 8:00 am, placing it in the 'very poor' category, according to data from the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

title: Amid Imran Khan's Death Rumours, Son Kasim Demands Proof Of Life
content: Imran Khan's son, Kasim, said that it has been 845 days since his father is under arrest. And, for the past one and a half month, he has been kept in death cell without any contact with family.

title: 5-Year-Old Kidnapped By Uncle, Sold For Rs 90,000, Mumbai Cops Rescue Her
content: Mumbai Police rescued a five-year-old girl who had been kidnapped and sold for Rs 90,000, tracing her to Panvel and reuniting her safely with her mother.

title: $100 Million Boost For India-Afghanistan Trade Marks Setback for Pakistan
content: In a significant development that signals a new phase of India-Afghanistan economic cooperation and a blow to Pakistan's regional trade influence, leading pharmaceutical companies from India and Afghanistan have signed a $100 million MoU.

title: Nuclear Power Sector To Open For Private Players Soon: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said India's tightly controlled nuclear power sector will soon be opened for private players, a move that will give new strength to the country's energy security.

title: Rs 1.02 Crore Gold Hidden In Bicycle Tyre Seized At India-Bangladesh Border
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) has seized gold worth nearly Rs 1.02 crore along the India-Bangladesh border in the Malda district of West Bengal, officials said on Thursday.

title: Russia Will End Ukraine War If Kyiv Cedes Land They Hold, Says Putin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that he would end his Ukraine offensive if Kyiv withdrew from territory Moscow claims at its own -- otherwise his army would take it by force.

title: Amid Imran Khan's Death Rumours, His Sister Says "We Don't Know Anything"
content: Noreen Niazi, one of the three sisters of former Pakistani PM Imran Khan, expressed anguish over the uncertainty looming about her brother's condition in jail, saying that authorities haven't allowed her and others to meet him for over four weeks.

title: Death Count In Hong Kong's Deadly Fire Rises To 94, Many Missing
content: Hong Kong authorities said on Friday the death toll from the city's worst fire in decades had risen to at least 83, as firefighters scoured torched high-rise buildings for scores of people still listed as missing.

title: Guard Member Dies Day After Shooting, Another Fighting For Life: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday that Sarah Beckstrom, one of the two National Guard troops shot a day earlier near the White House, had died, while the other soldier was "fighting for his life."

title: Ahmedabad-Bound Air India Plane Lands Back In Delhi After Smoke Indication
content: An Air India flight operating from Delhi to Ahmedabad on November 27 landed back in Delhi shortly after take-off after cockpit received a smoke indication from the aircraft's cargo hold, prompting the crew to initiate precautionary safety procedures.

title: 6.0 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Anchorage Area Of Alaska
content: A 6.0-magnitude earthquake rocked the Anchorage metropolitan area Thursday morning, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.

title: US To Review "Every" Green Card Of Some Nationalities After DC Shooting
content: The Trump administration announced Thursday that it would review every permanent residency status, known as Green Cards, for people from over a dozen countries following the attack on National Guard troops in Washington.

title: Afghans Say Last Path To Safety Shut As US Halts Visas After DC Shooting
content: Afghans who fled the Taliban and have waited years for a U.S. resettlement decision say their last path to safety has shut since Washington froze all Afghan immigration cases following a shooting near the White House.

title: FBI Launches Terror Probe After Washington DC Shooting
content: The FBI said Thursday it was launching a full-scale terror probe after a gunman carried out what officials described as an "ambush style" attack near the White House, shooting two National Guard soldiers multiple times with a revolver.

title: Iranian Nobel Laureate Says "Permanently" Barred From Leaving Country
content: Iranian Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi on Thursday said she was permanently barred from leaving Iran, in a birthday message to her teenage twins who she has not seen for over a decade.

title: Non-Europeans To Pay 45% More To Visit Louvre Next Year: Museum
content: The Louvre decided on Thursday to hike ticket prices for non-European visitors by 45%, the Paris museum and...

title: 'Couldnt Sleep All Night': Survivors Recall Deadly Hong Kong Fire
content: Hong Kong's worst fire in almost 80 years killed at least 65 people in an eight-building apartment complex, with more than 250 people still missing.

title: Putin Says Russia Will Fight On Unless Ukraine Withdraws From Their Territory
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that Moscow would end its Ukraine offensive if Kyiv withdrew from territory Moscow claims at its own -- otherwise they would take it by force.

title: Delhi Pollution Crisis: 68% Seek Medical Help, 85% Face Rising Costs
content: More than 80 per cent of residents in Delhi-NCR surveyed reported experiencing persistent health issues, including chronic cough, debilitating fatigue, and respiratory irritation due to polluted air, according to a survey.

title: ‘Where is home? What is my identity?’ asks transgender community in West Bengal amid fear over SIR
content: With many estranged from families, lacking documents and facial mismatch after transition, trans persons fear exclusion and renewed trauma during electoral roll revision

title: RGCB to be national metagenomics project hub
content: Programme aims to address the challenge of undiagnosed acute febrile illness, encephalitis, diarrhoeal diseases, and respiratory infections

title: A.P. govt. plans 29 new substations to meet imminent spurt in power demand
content: Energy Minister asks AP-Transco and DISCOMs to submit progress reports on transmission and distribution projects every 15 days

title: A.P. CM calls for adoption of TTD’s best practices in major temples in State
content: TTD’s web portal should be linked with the RTGS for monitoring, says Naidu; officials share plans to automate kitchen to serve anna prasadam to 2.75 lakh people per day

title: APCRDA project office bags IGBC Net Zero Energy rating
content: The Project Office at Rayapudi has become the first government building in India to receive the IGBC Net Zero Energy Rating at the design stage

title: Ratan Tata Hub launches ‘SPARK’ to nurture early-stage innovators in A.P.
content: The initiative aims to strengthen Andhra Pradesh’s growing innovation ecosystem by providing structured guidance at the formative stages of entrepreneurship

title: Hyderabad Police unveils revamped surveillance grid, EYES teams to boost CCTV reliability
content: Commissioner V.C. Sajjanar describes it as a major overhaul of how the city maintains and upgrades its surveillance infrastructure

title: CM vows to address issues of Amaravati farmers
content: Naidu assures that he will seek an exemption for farmers from the payment of capital gains tax for more time

title: Review tender issuing methodology to prevent loss to State exchequer: Kerala HC to Chief Secretary
content: PIL claims that tenders awarded by the Irrigation department for desilting reservoirs of the State were causing substantial loss to the public exchequer

title: Appear before court or face non-bailable warrant: Telangana HC to HYDRAA Commissioner
content: It was hearing a contempt of court case filed by a businessman accusing the HYDRAA Commissioner of willfully disobeying the HC order over his claims on Bathukamma Kunta lake land

title: How can teacher-BLOs decide citizenship, petitioners ask SC
content: Petitioners describe Election Commission’s decision as ‘dangerous and unreasonable’; counsel says EC devised SIR on the assumption that there’s huge influx of illegal immigrants into India; adds that Aadhaar is enough to prove voter eligibility

title: PETA slams passage of Assam law allowing festive buffalo fights
content: The Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (Assam Amendment) Bill, 2025, seeks to exempt the traditional buffalo fight during the mid-January Magh Bihu from the purview of a restrictive law

title: PM to attend annual police conference in Chhattisgarh’s Raipur
content: Discussions expected on left-wing extremism, counter terrorism, disaster management, women’s safety, forensic science and AI in policing; chance for senior police officers to share perspectives directly with PM

title: Farmers urge government to procure sugarcane directly
content: They say it should be ensured that the sugarcane is procured on time from the farmers and not at the last minute, raise complaints about various irregularities at the Direct Procurement Centres

title: Karnataka CM and his Deputy use word play and pun to target each other amid leadership battle
content: Responding to Mr. Shivakumar’s post on X, Mr. Siddaramaiah said hours later, “A Word is not power unless it betters the world for the people.”

title: J&K police search homes of Jamaat members, masjids and madrassas
content: The large-scale operation forms part of continuing preventive measures aimed at identifying and neutralising networks attempting to covertly revive the activities of proscribed organisations

title: Munambam holding: BJP urges Centre to implead in Waqf Vedhi’s appeal against HC order
content: The party to implead in case, while Munambam native Philip Joseph has already filed a caveat, says BJP leader

title: When a convicted Sengottaiyan stood disqualified from contesting elections
content: In the year 2000, Mr. Sengottaiyan was convicted in two different corruption cases and sentenced to jail attracting disqualification from contesting polls under the Representation of People Act

title: KSCA elections: Karnataka High Court reserves order on K.N. Shanth Kumar’s plea against rejection of his nomination papers
content: Justice Suraj Govindaraj reserved the verdict after hearing the arguments on behalf of Mr. Shanth Kumar, the KSCA, the Electoral Officer, and the other contestants for the post of president - former cricket players B.K. Venkatesh Prasad and Kalpana Venkatachar

title: Seeking the people's mandate in absentia
content: Sainul Abideen, Indian Union Muslim League candidate contesting the Karingamana ward of the Thamarassery grama panchayat, has been in hiding since October 21

title: West Bengal School Service Commission releases full details of 1,806 ‘tainted’ teacher recruits
content: Calcutta High Court also directs SSC to publish in the public domain answersheets of candidates who took the recently held selection test

title: Supreme Court asks government to regulate abusive online content
content: Top court suggests ‘impartial and autonomous authority’ to vet content; it says that like free speech, rights of victims of online abuse have to be protected, and wants ‘preventive mechanisms’ in place

title: BJP flags ‘foreign-located’ X handles pushing ‘anti-India’ narrative; ‘diversion tactic’, says Congress
content: BJP claims some Congress leaders, State units have X handles located in the U.S., Ireland, Thailand; Congress points to an X glitch and notes that the BJP Gujarat handle also shows its location as Ireland

title: Telangana Rising 2047 - Information Bureau to generate alternative credit scores mooted
content: Non-credit data such as utility bill payments, e-commerce transactions and government tax payment records will be integrated to assess individual repayment discipline

title: HC quashes proceedings against Seeman in case filed by IPS officer
content: It observes that Magistrates must be vigilant custodians of the BNSS safeguards, conscious that criminal defamation at the threshold, if loosely entertained, can have a disproportionate chilling effect on democratic contestation

title: LDF exudes confidencein winning majority oflocal bodies in Ernakulam
content: Titled ‘Our District, Our Dream’, the manifesto released by the Left Democratic Front, outlines comprehensive development of the district based on a policy upheld by the front

title: Heavy rain likely in A.P. for three days from Nov. 29 as cyclone Ditwah forms over Bay
content: Red alert issued for Nov. 30 for Prakasam, SPSR Nellore, Y.S.R Kadapa, Annamayya, Tirupati and Chittoor districts as very heavy to scattered extremely heavy rainfall is likely in these places

title: PM Modi meets Indian Women’s blind cricket team after T20 World Cup triumph
content: The members of the team presented Mr. Modi with an autographed bat while he also signed a ball for the team

title: Dance by 15 women candidates in Anthoor seeking votes goes viral
content: The Left Democratic Front candidates came together to perform an Oppana set to the tune of a Mappila song as part of seeking votes

title: Policemen should not act as ‘human machines’ and use excessive force: Madras High Court
content: Justice M. Nirmal Kumar quashes cases booked by CBI pursuant to the 2009 violent clash between police and lawyers inside High Court campus

title: OKC's Williams off injury report; to debut Friday
content: Jalen Williams is off the injury report and will make his season debut against the Phoenix Suns on friday night . the all-nBA guard had been recovering from right wrist surgery in July, then a procedure to have a screw removed on Oct. 31, after playing through a torn ligament last season .

title: NFL Week 13's fashionable arrivals, featuring Joe Burrow
content: week 13 of the season kicks off on Thanksgiving and rolls right into a rare Friday game . the week is set to feel like a football runway from the jump . some stadiums called for full cold-weather gear, others just a light fall layer, and players dressed for every forecast .

title: Thanksgiving throwbacks from Lions, Cowboys top NFL Week 13 looks
content: the Baltimore Ravens will wear their classic threads on the holiday against the green Bay Packers . the combination includes a silver helmet, navy jersey and white pant look . it's a busy week for alternates as part of the league's John Madden Thanksgiving celebration .

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks
content: the playbook for week 13 kicks off Thursday with three Thanksgiving day games . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . the weekly Shadow Reports: WR vs. CB Cheat Sheet .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
content: we're about one month into the 2025-26 NBA regular season and coming to the end of group play for the third-annual NBA Cup this week . the Detroit Pistons continue to be dominant through the first couple of weeks of play, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference and 2.5 games ahead of the Toronto Raptors . our insiders break down this week's NBA power rankings .

title: MLB offseason grades: AL champs land an ace as Blue Jays sign Cease
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, we'll weigh in with what it all means for next season and beyond .

title: 🏈 CFB Bottom 10: The 'Lane Train' hits the buffers
content: Paul Finebaum explains why it feels like Lane Kiffin will be picking a new job instead of staying at Ole miss . Rusty: "you think we need one more." "Ocean's Eleven" reminds you of Thanksgiving dinner and the laughs shared around the table .

title: CFP Bubble Watch after Tuesday's ranking: Who needs a win during Rivalry Week?
content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .

According to ESPN Analytics 6m 30m 12m

title: Cowboys remain hot, will play 'anybody, anywhere'
content: the cowboys have won three straight games for the first time since 2023 . they have inched over .500 for first time this season . in five days, the Cowboys beat the two participants in super bowl LIX in february .
